title: Clan

properties.name: description
properties.value: A clan is an organised group of players who participate together in group activities such as player killing, training skills, boss killing, minigames, or simply existing as a community of friends. Clans in Old School RuneScape have access to a number of clan-specific features, including Clan Chat, recruitment menus, the clan coffer, clan cloaks, vexillums, and the clan hall.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:ClanThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Clan
The official worlds for Clan Recruitment are worlds 497 (UK) (F2P), 477 (US) (P2P).
The clan portal at the Grand Exchange.

A clan is an organised group of players who participate together in group activities such as player killing, training skills, boss killing, minigames, or simply existing as a community of friends. Clans in Old School RuneScape have access to a number of clan-specific features, including Clan Chat, recruitment menus, the clan coffer, clan cloaks, vexillums, and the clan hall.

The clan system for Old School RuneScape was soft-launched on 19 May 2021, focusing on behind-the-scenes changes in preparation for the fully reworked system, which was launched on 26 May.

Contents

  • 1 Creating a clan
  • 2 Recruitment
  • 3 Clan features
  • 4 History
  • 5 Changes
  • 6 References

Creating a clan[edit | edit source]

The side panel for forming a clan

To register a clan, players need to travel to the Clan Hub in the south-east corner of the Grand Exchange and talk to Clerk. A side panel will appear that will guide players through the clan creation process, which requires the player to have spent at least 25 hours in-game, and have four other players (five total) to form a clan as founding members. A player can only be a ranked member of one clan, and only one clan can be created per player per day. Clans must have a unique name; players will be notified if the desired name is available or not.

Players can be invited as founding members to a clan by clicking the "Invite" button on the clan side panel, or by right-clicking the player within the Clan Hub and choosing the "Recruit" option.

The owner of the clan can request to resign at any point, which will start a 7 day countdown before transferring ownership. Owners will also automatically resign if they have not logged in to Old School RuneScape in a 90 day period. Ownership is transferred to the next highest ranking member of the clan. If there are multiple members with the same rank, the ownership is transferred to the member who has been part of the clan for the longest.

Recruitment[edit | edit source]

The recruitment menu for a clan

Once players are part of a clan, and they have the appropriate permissions, they can recruit other players to the clan via the "Applicants" menu. Clan members that are able to recruit can click the "Invite Applications" button on the top right to enable recruitment of prospective clan members. If a clan vexillum is equipped, they can also right-click a player and select the "Recruit" option to invite other players, though this requires the invitee to have Accept Aid enabled.

Players that are not part of a clan can look at the clan's info panel, accessed by interacting with the clan's entry on the recruitment board found in the Clan Hub if a recruiter lists their clan there. Players can also apply by joining a clan as a guest and clicking "Apply" via the "Settings" button in the guest clan tab. A confirmation message will appear before the application is sent.

Clan features[edit | edit source]

Clans and their members have access to several exclusive features:

  • Clan-only chat channel, and interfaces for managing the clan and recruiting members.
  • Clan Halls, a private area that can only be accessed by members of the clan the player is in.
  • Clan vexillums which can be used for advertising and recruiting other members to the clan.
  • Clan Coffer which acts as a private shared money bank for the clan.
  • Clan cloaks for all members of the clan to wear.
  • Recruiters can advertise the clan on the Recruitment Board in the Clan Hub at the Grand Exchange.
  • Clan Settings which allows players to customise their clan motif, rank titles, permissions, and more.

History[edit | edit source]

Clans have existed in RuneScape since the conception of the game. There were originally no official features in the game for clans, and players had to organise their own clans outside of the game. The most common types of clans in Old School are PvP clans, PvM clans, and skilling clans. Some clans have no specific focus, and some have a focus on specific minigames like Castle Wars, or quests.

Over the years, Jagex begun implementing features that directly benefitted clans. The first update was the release of team capes in February 2005. When worn, these do not allow players to left-click attack players with the same cape, and make it easier to identify teammates inside and outside the Wilderness. In addition to this, the in-game minimap was updated to show all players with the same cape as purple dots, thus making it easier to tell teammates apart from other players who still appear as white dots.

The RuneScape Forums offer several boards specific to clans. Players can view a thread listing open clans that they may join or advertise their own. The Clan Chat was added on 6 August 2007, which allows groups of players to communicate easily from anywhere in-game, without having to add everyone to their friends list as was common in the early years.

Clans participating in the Clan Wars minigame

Clan Wars was originally introduced to RuneScape on 10 December 2007 as an alternative means of PvP. This was at the same time PvP in the Wilderness was removed along with free trade in order to combat the prevalent issue of botting. It was reintroduced to Old School on 19 June 2014.

From 2013 to 2015, Jagex hosted the Clan Cup. Clans could take part in a series of challenges, and the winning clans had their name added to the clan cup trophy (2013) or a clan statue erected at the former Clan Wars lobby with a likeness of their characters (2014-2015). In 2013, the Clan Cup consisted solely of PvP challenges in the Clan Wars Arena, and PvM and Skilling challenges were added from 2014 onwards.

On 25 February 2021, Jagex shared an update around a long-awaited clan rework,[1] and opened up pre-registration for players to claim clan names on 16 April.[2] Pre-registration could only be submitted by the owner of the proposed clan, and all requests were manually reviewed. The form for pre-registering clan names closed on 11 May. Successful applicants received a message to their inbox by 19 May inviting them to join a Discord server to arrange registration of their clan name, which included meeting up with a J-Mod in-game to have their clan assigned.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
23 March 2022
(update)

Clan members can now leave the clan's chat channel entirely, replacing the option to mute it instead.

9 March 2022
(update)
  • Obtaining Barrows items, Amulet of eternal glory, and the Pharaoh's sceptre are now broadcasted to the Clan chat, assuming they exceed the minimum value set in clan settings.
  • Pet broadcasts will now include the killcount or experience the pet was obtained at.
  • New settings have been added to be able to further customise clan level up broadcasts.
  • New settings has also been added for configuring the following broadcasts:
    • New Collection Log entries
    • New personal bests (only appears after beating your current personal best)
    • Player kills (under a threshold set by the clan)
    • When a clan member dies in PvP
    • Completion of an Achievement Diary tier
    • 10 million XP milestones above level 99
    • Hardcore Ironman deaths (this same setting will announce when a Hardcore Group Ironman player loses a life even when their status doesn't change)
10 November 2021
(update)

Fixed a bug where mega rare clue rewards were not being broadcasted through the Clan system.

20 October 2021
(update)

Valuable clue rewards, Zulrah mutagens, and first time Infernal capes are now broadcast to the Clan chat.

21 July 2021
(update)

Clans now have the option to broadcast Combat Achievements tier completions.

14 July 2021
(update)

Clan level-up notifications are no longer broadcasted for levels below 50.

23 June 2021
(update)
  • Notification settings have been added to the Clan Settings, allowing broadcasts that occur when a clan member does various activities, such as obtaining a valuable drop or a pet.
  • All active recruiters are now notified when applications are received or withdrawn.
  • Barbarian Assault has now been added as a social activity for the purpose of setting up events.
  • Clan owners are now told who is the next in line to become the new owner in the resignation interface.
  • The rank Peon has been renamed to Pawn.
  • A new rank, Helper, has been added.
  • The rank Ruby has been made a darker shade of red.
  • The ranks using metal bars have been recoloured.
3 June 2021
(update)
  • Worlds 477 (US) & 497 (UK) are now themed worlds for Clan recruitment.
  • Players will now automatically rejoin a guest channel if they were in one when they last logged out.
  • The bank sign in the Clan Hall no longer blocks line-of-sight, so you can cast the telegrab spell through it.
  • The default guest Clan Chat colour is now distinct from the Clan Chat colour, and can be customised.
  • You can now teleport, enter the Wilderness, fletch, blow glass and perform emotes while your vexillum is equipped.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. "Clans Progress Update." Old School RuneScape News.
  2. ↑ Jagex. "Clans: Pre-Registration." Old School RuneScape News.

{{External|rs|rsc}}
{{Official world|name=Clan Recruitment|f2p=497 (UK)|p2p=477 (US)}}
[[File:Clan Hub.png|thumb|350px|The clan portal at the Grand Exchange.]]
[[File:Your Clan icon.png|left]]
A '''clan''' is an organised group of players who participate together in group activities such as [[player killing]], training [[skill]]s, [[boss killing]], [[minigames]], or simply existing as a community of friends. Clans in ''Old School RuneScape'' have access to a number of clan-specific features, including [[Clan Chat]], recruitment menus, the clan coffer, clan cloaks, vexillums, and the clan hall.

The clan system for ''Old School RuneScape'' was soft-launched on [[19 May]] [[2021]], focusing on behind-the-scenes changes in preparation for the fully reworked system, which was launched on [[26 May]].

==Creating a clan==
[[File:Clan formation interface.png|thumb|The side panel for forming a clan]]
To register a clan, players need to travel to the [[Clan Hub]] in the south-east corner of the [[Grand Exchange]] and talk to [[Clerk (Clan Hub)|Clerk]]. A side panel will appear that will guide players through the clan creation process, which requires the player to have spent at least 25 hours in-game, and have four other players (five total) to form a clan as founding members. A player can only be a ranked member of one clan, and only one clan can be created per player per day. Clans must have a unique name; players will be notified if the desired name is available or not.

Players can be invited as founding members to a clan by clicking the "Invite" button on the clan side panel, or by right-clicking the player within the Clan Hub and choosing the "Recruit" option.

The owner of the clan can request to resign at any point, which will start a 7 day countdown before transferring ownership. Owners will also automatically resign if they have not logged in to ''Old School RuneScape'' in a 90 day period. Ownership is transferred to the next highest ranking member of the clan. If there are multiple members with the same rank, the ownership is transferred to the member who has been part of the clan for the longest.

==Recruitment==
[[File:Clan Settings - applicants.png|thumb|The recruitment menu for a clan]]
Once players are part of a clan, and they have the appropriate permissions, they can recruit other players to the clan via the "Applicants" menu. Clan members that are able to recruit can click the "Invite Applications" button on the top right to enable recruitment of prospective clan members. If a [[clan vexillum]] is equipped, they can also right-click a player and select the "Recruit" option to invite other players, though this requires the invitee to have [[Accept Aid]] enabled.

Players that are not part of a clan can look at the clan's info panel, accessed by interacting with the clan's entry on the recruitment board found in the Clan Hub if a recruiter lists their clan there. Players can also apply by joining a clan as a guest and clicking "Apply" via the "Settings" button in the guest clan tab. A confirmation message will appear before the application is sent.

==Clan features==
Clans and their members have access to several exclusive features:

* Clan-only chat channel, and interfaces for managing the clan and recruiting members.
* [[Clan Hall]]s, a private area that can only be accessed by members of the clan the player is in.
* [[Clan vexillum]]s which can be used for advertising and recruiting other members to the clan.
* [[Clan Coffer]] which acts as a private shared [[gold coins|money]] bank for the clan.
* [[Clan cloak]]s for all members of the clan to wear.
* Recruiters can advertise the clan on the Recruitment Board in the Clan Hub at the Grand Exchange.
* [[Clan Settings]] which allows players to customise their clan motif, rank titles, permissions, and more.

==History==
Clans have existed in ''RuneScape'' since the conception of the game. There were originally no official features in the game for clans, and players had to organise their own clans outside of the game. The most common types of clans in Old School are PvP clans, PvM clans, and skilling clans. Some clans have no specific focus, and some have a focus on specific [[minigame]]s like [[Castle Wars]], or [[quests]].

Over the years, [[Jagex]] begun implementing features that directly benefitted clans. The first update was the release of [[team cape]]s in February [[2005]]. When worn, these do not allow players to left-click attack players with the same cape, and make it easier to identify teammates inside and outside the Wilderness. In addition to this, the in-game minimap was updated to show all players with the same cape as purple dots, thus making it easier to tell teammates apart from other players who still appear as white dots.

The [[RuneScape Forums]] offer several boards specific to clans. Players can view a thread listing open clans that they may join or advertise their own. The [[Clan Chat]] was added on [[6 August]] [[2007]], which allows groups of players to communicate easily from anywhere in-game, without having to add everyone to their friends list as was common in the early years.

[[File:Clan Wars.png|thumb|Clans participating in the Clan Wars minigame]]
[[Clan Wars]] was originally introduced to RuneScape on [[10 December]] [[2007]] as an alternative means of PvP. This was at the same time PvP in the Wilderness was removed along with free trade in order to combat the prevalent issue of [[botting]]. It was reintroduced to Old School on [[19 June]] [[2014]].

From 2013 to 2015, Jagex hosted the [[Clan Cup]]. Clans could take part in a series of challenges, and the winning clans had their name added to the clan cup trophy (2013) or a clan statue erected at the former Clan Wars lobby with a likeness of their characters (2014-2015). In 2013, the Clan Cup consisted solely of PvP challenges in the Clan Wars Arena, and PvM and Skilling challenges were added from 2014 onwards.

On [[25 February]] [[2021]], Jagex shared an update around a long-awaited clan rework,{{CiteNews|url=https://secure.runescape.com/m=news/clans-progress-update?oldschool=1|title=Clans Progress Update|date=25 February 2021}} and opened up pre-registration for players to claim clan names on [[16 April]].{{CiteNews|url=https://secure.runescape.com/m=news/clans-pre-registration?oldschool=1|title=Clans: Pre-Registration|date=16 April 2021}} Pre-registration could only be submitted by the owner of the proposed clan, and all requests were manually reviewed. The form for pre-registering clan names closed on [[11 May]]. Successful applicants received a message to their inbox by [[19 May]] inviting them to join a Discord server to arrange registration of their clan name, which included meeting up with a [[Jagex Moderator|J-Mod]] in-game to have their clan assigned.
